title.value: Экономическая эффективность возделывания различных сортов льна-долгунца
Economic efficiency of fibre flax different varieties cultivation

journal.title: Agriculture and Plant Protection : scientific-practical journal

person.name: Belov, D.A., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute of Flax

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there were presented results of the cost-effectiveness of cultivation of different varieties of fiber flax (Linum usitatissimum). The cultivation of flax varieties Laska, Vesta, Marilyn and Suzanna on loamy soil with humus 1,70-1,75% optimum dose of nitrogen fertilizer was 15 kg / ha of active substance. It was found that when fiber flax was sown after cereal crops on loam with medium security batteries middle-grade Vesta and early maturing variety Laska total fiber yields slightly inferior to late-ripening varieties Marilyn and Suzanne, but surpass them in quality fiber. One hectare of flax middle-grade Vesta provides the highest profit of USD 268-1585. Profit per hectare of crop varieties Suzanne 143-1579, grades Laska - 236-1334, grades Marilyn -194-1227 USD.
